title: libcurl: SMTP end-of-response out-of-bounds read - CVE-2019-3823
content:
Code 347 Bytes
1libcurl contains a heap out-of-bounds read in the code handling the
2end-of-response for SMTP.
3
4If the buffer passed to `smtp_endofresp()` isn't NUL terminated and contains
5no character ending the parsed number, and `len` is set to 5, then the
6`strtol()` call reads beyond the allocated buffer. The read contents will not
7be returned to the caller.
The issue was reported to the project on 18 January 2019.
A patch was sent to me on 19 January 2019.
curl 7.64.0 was released on 6 January 2019.
https://curl.haxx.se/docs/CVE-2019-3823.html
Impact
If the buffer passed to smtp_endofresp() isn't NUL terminated and contains no character ending the parsed number, and len is set to 5, then the strtol() call reads beyond the allocated buffer.
steps: Prepare a buffer that is not NUL terminated and contains no character ending the parsed number.
Call the `smtp_endofresp()` function with this buffer and set `len` to 5.
vuln_description: libcurl contains a heap out-of-bounds read in the code handling the end-of-response for SMTP. If the buffer passed to `smtp_endofresp()` isn't NUL terminated and contains no character ending the parsed number, and `len` is set to 5, then the `strtol()` call reads beyond the allocated buffer. The read contents will not be returned to the caller.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward buffer read issue with specific conditions (non-NUL terminated buffer, specific length). The conditions are clear and the interaction is not complex or subtle.
